alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Greene; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 11:51PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WARREN, NORTHWESTERN CLINTON, GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM EDT... At 1150 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Lebanon, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Kettering, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Mason, Xenia, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Wilmington, Bellbrook, Moraine, Oakwood, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, West Carrollton, Cedarville, Waynesville and Jamestown. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio near mile marker 41. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 21 and 60. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 41 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
